articles.description: Manchester City beat Fluminense to win the Fifa Club World Cup for the first time - becoming the first English side to win five trophies in a calendar year.
articles.title: Man City make history with Club World Cup win

articles.description: As Aston Villa miss the chance to go top of the Premier League for the first time in 12 years, midfielder John McGinn calls for "perspective".
articles.title: Villa call for perspective in 'miracle' title race

articles.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp encourages his fans to give Arsenal the "proper Anfield experience" during their Premier League game on Saturday.
articles.title: Let's give Arsenal 'proper Anfield experience' - Klopp

articles.description: Australia opener Usman Khawaja says the black armband he wore during the first Test against Pakistan was for a "personal bereavement" and not in support of civilians in Gaza.
articles.title: Khawaja says armband was for 'personal bereavement'

articles.description: Uruguay striker Luiz Suarez joins Inter Miami, where he will link up again with ex-Barcelona team-mates Lionel Messi, Sergio Busquets and Jordi Alba.
articles.title: Suarez reunites with Messi at Inter Miami

articles.description: Anthony Joshua boasts a 13lb weight advantage over Otto Wallin for Saturday's must-win heavyweight fight.
articles.title: 'Happy' Joshua weighs in 13lb heavier than Wallin

articles.description: Hard-hitting Deontay Wilder - who fights Joseph Parker on Saturday - has boxed fewer than three minutes in two years but remains one of boxing's star attractions.
articles.title: 'People want to see a knockout and that's what I do'

articles.description: Five-time world champion Raymond van Barneveld begins his bid for the 2024 PDC title with a confident win over Poland's Radek Szaganski.
articles.title: PDC World Championship 2024: Raymond van Barneveld & Chris Dobey through in London

articles.description: Joel Embiid manages at least 30 points and 10 rebounds in a game for the 13th time in a row to help his Philadelphia 76ers beat the Toronto Raptors 121-111.
articles.title: NBA: Joel Embiid hepls 76ers win and moves closer to Kareem Abdul-Jabbar's record

articles.description: BBC Sport's Simon Stone looks at the proposals for a new breakaway European competition and assesses what could happen next.
articles.title: European Super League - what happens next?
